intro: Rourea induta var. induta, commonly known as the velvetleaf rourea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that give it a distinctive velvety appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cup-shaped structures called cyathia. The plant is often cultivated as an ornamental due to its unique foliage and ability to thrive in warm, moist conditions.
